measured_by: 6-point Likert rating of “What [agent] did was morally acceptable”
justification: “The use of 5-point Likert scale to measure difficulty … and 6-point Likert scale for moral judgments was adapted… we did reverse scoring the moral acceptability measure.”

measured_by: Yes/No question ‘Do you think [agent] committed transgression?’
justification: “Participants would have to rate their moral judgments: 1) perceived-transgression … in a yes/no binary format.”

measured_by: Yes/No question ‘Would you disclose what [agent] did to the police?’
justification: “The willingness was measured on a binary scale (i.e., yes/no)… ‘if a police officer comes to you and asks what happened, would you disclose…’.”
“Based on your response above, how difficult is it to consider disclosing/ not disclosing what [agent's name] did … in a 5-point Likert scale.”
“We subsequently asked the participants … how close they feel they are to the brother on a 5-point Likert scale.”
